Package com.valmet.watermark.advice

Class RestExceptionHandler

java.lang.Object
com.valmet.watermark.advice.RestExceptionHandler
@RestControllerAdvice @Order(-2147483648) public class RestExceptionHandler extends Object
Global exception handler for the application.

This class centralizes exception handling using RestControllerAdvice, allowing consistent and standardized error responses across all REST controllers. It provides handlers for common exceptions, including custom application exceptions and security-related exceptions.

Key Features:

  • Handles validation, authentication, and JWT-related exceptions.
  • Logs detailed stack traces for debugging purposes.
  • Returns structured error responses using BaseResponse.

The class is annotated with:

  • RestControllerAdvice: Enables global exception handling for REST controllers.
  • Order: Specifies precedence in case multiple exception handlers are defined.
  • Slf4j: Provides logging capabilities using SLF4J.
Version:
1.0
Author:
BJIT

    • handleValidationExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> handleValidationExceptions(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException ex)
      Handles validation exceptions for method arguments.

      This method captures MethodArgumentNotValidException thrown when a method argument annotated with @Valid fails validation. It extracts the validation errors and returns them in a structured format.

      Parameters:
      ex - the MethodArgumentNotValidException containing validation errors
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a map of field names and their corresponding error messages, with a HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST status

    • handleMissingParams

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.multipart.support.MissingServletRequestPartException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> handleMissingParams(org.springframework.web.multipart.support.MissingServletRequestPartException ex)
      Handles exceptions when a required request part is missing.

      This method captures MissingServletRequestPartException thrown when a required part of a multipart request is missing. It logs the missing part name and returns a ResponseEntity with a HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST status and an error message.

      Parameters:
      ex - the MissingServletRequestPartException containing details about the missing request part
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST status and an error message indicating the missing part
